com.cinchapi.concourse.db

Class Row

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cinchapi.concourse.db.Row
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteSized, Persistable, IterableByteSequences

    public class Row
extends java.lang.Object
implements IterableByteSequences, Persistable

    Represents a Cell set where each is mapped from a Column name. A row can hold up to 53687091 cells throughout its lifetime, but in actuality this limit is lower because the size of a cell can very widely and is guaranteed to increase with every revision. Therefore it is more useful to use the maximum allowable storage for a row as a guide.

    Storage Requirements

    • An empty row occupies 16 bytes.
    • A row, and all of its cells, cannot occupy more than 2147483647 bytes.

    Author:
    jnelson

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(java.nio.channels.FileChannel channel)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Persistable
        Write the object to a writable channel. This method should acquire a lock over the region from the channels current position plus the ByteSized.size() of the value. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the channel is in the correct position before and after this method has run. In general, call Persistable.Writer.write(Persistable, FileChannel) from this method.
        Specified by:
        writeTo in interface Persistable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Persistable.Writer#write(Persistable, FileChannel)}
